original_solution_mapping.L1: He needs to earn $150 more dollars because 500 - 200 - 150 = <<500-200-150=150>>150
original_solution_mapping.L2: He needs to sell 20 games because 150 / 7.5 = <<150/7.5=20>>20

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3150.
    Returns: the number of games Percy needs to sell.
    """
    # L1
    playstation_cost = 500 # PlayStation, which costs $500
    birthday_money = 200 # $200 on his birthday
    christmas_money = 150 # $150 at Christmas
    money_needed = playstation_cost - birthday_money - christmas_money

    # L2
    game_price = 7.5 # $7.5 each
    games_to_sell = money_needed / game_price

    # FA
    answer = games_to_sell
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He needs to earn $150 more dollars because {playstation_cost} - {birthday_money} - {christmas_money} = <<{playstation_cost}-{birthday_money}-{christmas_money}={money_needed}>>{money_needed}
He needs to sell {games_to_sell} games because {money_needed} / {game_price} = <<{money_needed}/{game_price}={games_to_sell}>>{games_to_sell}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He needs to earn $150 more dollars because 500 - 200 - 150 = <<500-200-150=150>>150
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He needs to sell 1 games because 150 / 150 = <<150/150=1>>1

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'money_needed' (150) was used instead of 'game_price' (7.5).
